text: BB backlog. Bottle from Capones, pours a black color with small to average sized foam. Smell is big on roasted malt, dark cherry, whiskey, and coffee. Flavor of chocolate, bourbon, fudge, malt, and raisins. Rich and complex mouthfeel that warmed us all up.

20/II/16 - 75cl bottle @ RBBWG V (Bens place) - BB: n/a (2016-216) Thanks to ElManana+1 for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark purple brown beer, small irregular beige to brown head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: roasted, mocha, some caramel, bit sweet, vanilla, alcohol, sugary. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: very refreshing, some almonds, bit sourish, cherries, soft roast, some mocha. Aftertaste: more cherries, alcohol, bit sourish, almonds, marzipan, soft roast, lovely beer!

Very deep, very creamy dark tan head. Dark aroma, red berries, dough Not too sweet, red grapes, aged. Lighter than expected taste, delicate is a better word. After a series of very strong tasting beers, it almost feels flat, but it is complex and intresting. Well done beer. (Sampled at the RBBWG 2016)

From bottle at RBBWG 2016 in Antwerpen, bottled in October 2012. Clear, very dark red to black with a brown head. Sweetish-malty, slightly fruity aroma of dark chocolate, licorice, coffee and dark ripe fruits (cherries). Sweetish-malty, slightly fruity taste of dark chocolate, coffee, some licorice and dark ripe fruits, followed by a long, slightly bitter, warming and rather alcoholic finish. Medium body, slightly oily mouthfeel. Very nice!

Thank you for sharing ElManana + 1! 750 ml. bottle sampled @ RBBWG V. Near black, dark tanned head. Nose is sweet sugary mocha combined with strong cherries mixed with mocha, vanilla, sugar, bourbon, chocolate. Taste of sour cherries is very strong sour cherries, mocha, warming vanilla, sugar, chocolate, mocha, bourbon, Amount of sour cherries is very big here almost a bit too big, abandoning the balance here, taking it touch down. Touch less sour cherries & this would have been astonishing, touch unbalanced now but very good never the less. Warming syrupy mocha body, chocolate. Very nice & interesting all the same.

Sampled from bottle @ Ratebeer Belgian Winter Gathering 2016. Opaque dark brown color, slight red glare coming through when held into the light, average sized light brown colored head. Cherry and red fruit aroma. Taste malts, red fruits, lightly dark malts, malt bitter, fruitpeel bitter. Decent body and carbonation.
Bottle at RBBWG, thanks for sharing me! Cherry, chocolate, light bourbon, quite sweet, but sour from the cherries all at the same time. Nice.

Poured a deep black color with aromas of bourbon, light sweet cherries, roast and some light earth. Flavors are the same with s nice bourbon flavor thrown in, liked this, solid overall would hunt down again.

750ml bottle, batch 11600, 1/9/2016. Bottle 333. Pours dark brown, almost black, with dark tan head, fading to the surface within a minute or two, few splotches left bubbling from within the liquid. Aroma strongly dominated by cherries, slightly tart but rich and juicy, dark chocolate, some roast and coffee underneath with vanilla, fruity bourbon strongly influenced again with cherries. Taste is chocolate cherry, cola, caramel and bourbon barrel, long cherry finish, quite distinct flavor lingering, lasts for ages. Medium body. Very interesting- cherries take on a slightly tart aspect but meld well with other components, and a great finish, very distinctive. Well done.

Batch 11600, bottled 10-17-2012, bottle 31/1718, 750 ml. I think Ive had this for a little over a year, was surprised to see its near 3 years old. A nice gift. Pours the deepest darkest brown into black with a short-lived, fizzy large bubbled brown head that settles to a ring and leaves a couple spots of lace. Nose involves dark bitter chocolate, cherry pie, leather, toasted coconut, subtle bourbon and oak char, almost some flowery notes. Pretty sweet, somewhat bitter, kind of tart. Medium to full bodied, somewhat active, pretty oily, with a lengthy tart and chocolaty bitter finish. A nice tasty treat, lots of cherry going on in there, moreso than the bourbon, but it all works pretty well. Wouldnt say its starting to go downhill, but glad I cracked it now.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2015 Bottle. Pours opaque black, small brown quickly diminishing head, some lacing. Aroma is sweet, cherry chocolates, bourbon, vanilla. Flavor is fully sweet, light bitter, loads of cherry, some tartness, due to cherry or otherwise. Lightish body.
Pours jet black with a thin mocha head. Aroma of cherries and chocolate. Taste is bourbon, cherries, chocolate and brown sugar. Sweet, great dessert beer.

Wow. This is so good. Aromas are mostly barrel forward. Vanilla, bourbon, and coconut. A bit of cherry as it warms. Sour cherry flavors, roasty malt and dark chocolate. Notes of coconut and vanilla too. This is barrel aged beer done right. Perfectly balanced.

On tap at 2014 GTMW, I dont get it, they were pouring this and Barrel Expedition and nobody was around, I mean nobody, had several pours each with zero line, awesome, pours black with a thin brown head and some spotty lacing in the glass, the aroma has quite a bit of cherry at first with the bourbon and oak coming through, the flavor has a nice amount of chocolate and cherry at first with a bourbon and oaky finish, smooth mouthfeel, good stuff.
Bottle. Color is black with nice rust head. Cherry and wood aroma. Taste is chocolate and tart cherry thick and sweet. Barrel comes on finish
Bottle - Barrel and cherry with malts. Deep jet black with a nice brown head. Wood, cherry and very dry. Boozy, cherry and wood. Oddly medicinal.
Enjoyed at the 2014 Firestone Walker Invitational. Forceful cherry tanginess with a delicate bourbon touch. Very thin and watery, however.

Bottle thanks to Russell. Pours a dark brown with small beige head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is wood, booze, vanilla, cherry skin. Thin mouthfeel with syrupy cherry, dark chocolate, wood, light boozy finish. Very good.

Bottle shared thanks to JBPortland ! Pours a rich burnt umber color with a finger of tight bubbled khaki foam. Nose is a bit hot of the bat but settles into a chocolate cake, bourbon soaked cherry pie combination. The palate is smooth and lush. Big roasted cocoa, coconut, sweet cherry pie filling, bourbon heat. Really delicious and well balanced flavors !

750ml bottle pours dark rich brown with a medium tan head. Nose is dark fruity bourbon, berry, some light oak, roasty rich bitter cocoa. Taste is medium body, fruity bourbon spice cherry cola and rich dusty bakers chocolate, dark cocoa cake, soft barrel wood. Finish is creamy chocolate truffle cake with layered boozy berry bourbon spice and roasty cocoa. Delicious!
Enjoyed at FWIBF 2014,,, Dark black with tan head... Thick mouthfeel... Aroma of cherries, dark malts, vanilla... Chocolate, cherry, vanilla, roasted malts.... Amazing

Bottle courtesy of Kermis. Huge thanks. Poured a dark mahogany with a thin dark tan head. The aroma is rich red berry fruit boozy alcohol, chewy yeast. The flavour is medium sweet with a light crisp acid cherry palate. Light bodied with average carbonation and a bubbly frothy mouthfeel. Medium to light bodied with average carbonation.

Bottle shared. Pours near black with a ring tan head. Aroma of cherries, vanilla, oak, bourbon, overripe dark fruits, cocoa, roast, hairspray, toffee and raisins. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter. Full bodied with moderate carbonation.

bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Thin tan head. Clear black pour. Cherry tartness. A lovely bourbon barrel aged stout.

Bottle purchased at Bells and shared at Muckfest V on 7/11/14. Darkest brown pour with a thin tan head. Aroma of Mon Cheri candies; lots of cherry, booze and chocolate. Flavor is malty and chocolatey with some smoke before a tart cherry finish.
Bottle shared by Randall. Chocolatey bouquet. Dark brown pour with a tan head. Dark roasted malts, cherries, and mild bourbon. Average body good mouthfeel.

Bottle share at Tribes Alehouse. Bottle from 2007. Pour is black with almost no head. Aroma and flavor of chocolate covered cherries, bourbon, vanilla, and wood chips. Finish is mildly sweet with the bourbon coming through more.
Bottle - pours dark brown with a light tan head. Nice cherry notes in the nose with some chocolate, oak, and bourbon. The taste is balanced between cherry and chocolate. It warms up nicely.
Pours black like oil with tan head. Sour cherries on the nose; follows onto the palate. Fairly one dimensional.

750ml bottle I traded FFF Rue D Floyd for. Lost that trade. Poured black with thinning dark tan head. Decent cherry in the aroma backed by bourbon heat. Med light carb med bod. Charred light cherry taste with ok bourbon. Not that good.
Bottle poured at FWIBF. Pours a deep brown to black with tan/brown head. Aroma of coffee and cherry liquor. Taste is vanilla, oak, cherry candy and some maple syrup. Much thicker than the ABV.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Sweet. A bit of bourbon remains years later, but the cherry component is still prominent. Has aged pretty nicely, but not to the level of Expedition or Black Note.

2012 batch on tap. Pours dense black with red in the thin parts and tan fizz. The aroma is sweet cherry and toasted malts with a strong hinting of oak. The flavor is rich stout with a mild cherry that is balancing tart and sweet with moderate barrel, more oak than bourbon. Mostly dry finish that aids the cherry tart but still would like it to be more tart. Lightly wine like finish, gets progressively better with warmth, very good beer.
On tap at the Michigan Summer Beer Fest. First one of the day. A heavy deep cherry note. Really creamy. A solid beer.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2014 Tap: Nearly black with only a very thin outline of ruby and dark brown. Espresso colored head shows excellent staying power and clings to the glass nicely. Aroma is rich, sweet cherry juice meets bourbon-soaked oak chips. Lots of cherry, bourbon, roasted malt, mild vanilla. Sweet, faintly tart, a little syrupy, and very decadent. The taste includes plenty of sweet cherry juice over a background of warming bourbon, oak, and light tannins. Some prunes come alongside the cherries with a very light tartness. Vanilla, oak, dark cocoa, and some molasses come to play as well. Never gets too sweet, too tart, or too hot. Good barrel and fruit meshing with the stout flavors... Awesome brew.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2014 Sampled at 2013 MBG Summer Festival. Very nice cherry and roasted malt aroma with some light oak and bourbon. Taste has a nice light sweetness with a light tartness in the finish. Barrel is stronger in the taste than the aroma, lots of oak and vanilla but the bourbon remains light and smooth. Cherries and roasted malt balances pretty well with the bourbon. Smooth beer and very easy to drink.

2014 bottle thanks to rayl101 for sharing.  Not much to add to my original rate.  Not complex at all but tasty.  Cherries, roast, and bourbon.
Bottle. Thanks to foppa87 for sharing. Pours a black color with tan head.  Light roasty, bourbon, cherry aromas.  Light syrupy cherry, some roasty, vanilla, and bourbon flavors.

Bottle in KC @ JetsonFest III. Thanks foppa78! Batch 7777, November 2008 bottle date. Pours a deep brown appearance with a thin brown head. Somewhat spicy, tart but sweet black pie cherry, caramel, light cinnamon, mild whiskey aroma. Tart, cherry puree, dark chocolate, caramel/vanilla whiskey flavor. Slightly tart. Pretty tasty.
On tap at jk odonnells for bells tap take over. Pours dark black with a tan/reddish head. Srong bourbon aroma. Cherry vanilla oak and bourbon taste.

Backlog rating 1-23-2009 (Bottle at Fort Wayne Gathering) This beer pours a small light brown head that had poor retention, very little lacing, opaque body, and a black-brown hue.  The Aroma is cherries, bourbon, chocolate, and earthy.  The Flavors consist of cherries, chocolate, vanilla, oak, boozy, and bourbon.  The Mouthfeel is tingly and this is a medium bodied beer.  Overall, this beer is very quaffable, the flavors are nicely balanced and definitely worth trying.  I would drink this beer again and it is a beer I recommend.
This score is from my backlog at a different site. Full reviews written for all new beers tasted.
On tap at proof. Black pour with creamy tan head. Aroma chocolate covered cherries and wood. Taste lots of sour cherries and chocolate finished with wood pulp.

Draft at Proof. Porch black pour with a frothy brown head. Sweet bourbon, wood, vanilla, sweet chocolate, light roast and subtle cherry with notes of booze, already way better than the base beer. Sweet chocolate covered cherries up front with sweet vanilla, bourbon oak with the cherries coming in for a quick tart ending. Medium thick bodied with no hot booze. Way better than the base beer. Great stuff.

Pours an opaque black on tap with pillowy reddish brown head and light lacing. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, oak, sweet chocolate. Taste follows with a hint of cherry that cuts the bourbon and gives you a birthday cake flavor. Delicious.

On tap during the Bells Eccentric Cafe Day at the Hungry Monk. Big, boozy, bourbon nose with slight dark cherry, hint of oak, and some sour acidity. Pours a clear midnight black with a filmy tan head. Taste of sour cherries early with a very smooth woody finish. Slightly sour aftertaste is the only bourbon flavor despite the aroma. Tart, sticky mouthfeel with a smooth dry finish. Better than the keg of 2012 Black Note also on tap at the event, but not quite cohesive enough to be labeled a cant-miss barrel-aged stout.
If you like the batch 9000 Bourbon from bells, youll love this too. The cherry cuts a bit of the Bourbon flavor,  but its awesome

An interesting selection that proved that beers can take you on a wild and wonderful journey of taste in ways that you may have never thought of before.  A subtle hint of cherry in this dark stout is sure to please the pallate.

Draft.  Poured black with a nice tan head.  Aroma and flavor were mildly tart cherry (more restrained than I thought itd be), some chocolate, molasses, lots of sweet malt.  Barrel aging adds lots of bourbon, some vanilla, a mild woodiness.  Thick mouthfeel.  Glad I got to try this.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2013 On tap at crunchys in east Lansing. I am not a huge fan of the original cherry stout. However, the BB fixes everything I dont like about the original. The bourbon and vanilla tone down the super tart cherry flavor and sweeten up the malt. Delicious.
draft at beer fest.  The BBL cuts down on the overpowering cherry but still not quite enough for my taste.  NIce but nothing I need to chase after.

Smells of bourbon. Very little cherry but its there. Taste is good but a tad sweet. Glad I tried it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught at Beer Trappe. Bourbon and cherry. The previous cherry is slightly muted but stands out in a bit of tart and fruit. Nice overall.

Sample at Jungle Jims Barrel Aged Tasting, on tap. Awesome vanilla and chocolate syrup aroma. Dark but still clear color. Nearly no head, but few dots of lace. Big bitter taste, pretty tart also. Bigger body, dry texture, light carbonation, little bite. Light / moderate cherry, some chocolate. Little bourbon boozy finish. Solid, tasty, bourbon barrel ale.

Damn was this good. Aroma was tart cherry, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, and sex. Poured super black with some tan lacing. The tartness from the cherries is not lost at all with the chocolate and bourbon notes. Very well balanced with just the right amount of fruity esters and barrel aged qualities. Awesome brew.
Black, no head. Nose is bourbon, wet wood, tart cherry. Taste is big tart cherry, chocolate, light bourbon. Syrupy mouthfeel.

To finally try this beer... Snifter pour at Oblivion Taproom. The body is a deep murky brown with a chalky-tan head. It smelled like a cherry tootsie-roll pop in a box with wet pencils - THAT good. The taste was full of tart cherry, chocolate, lightly boozy bourbon and vanilla towards the finish. I do not regret saying that this beer sodomizes Black Note - WAY too much hype there.

On tap @ New Bohemian.  Black color with a small head.  Aroma of vanilla, cherries and oak.  Sweet malt flavor.  Lighter cherry than expected, but still quite tart.  Only a little vanilla carries over from the bourbon.
UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Tap at New Bohemia. Very dark pour with a frothy head. Bright tart cherry on a nice dense stout - terrific beer.

On tap at New Bohemia, has some nice sweet cherry/vanilla and barrel notes. Taste is similar with the wood notes really coming out, followed by a nice cherry tartness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at New Bohemia tap takeover. Aroma is filled with vanilla and cherry notes! Deep dark black. First taste slams you in the face with cherry, tartness! It finishes with a strong tart flavor that rolls into vanilla and a nice finish. Really enjoy it! Palate is solid and tasty. Overall great beer to try!
On draft. Looks good; black with thin tan lacing. Smells and tastes good too; cherry, malt, and bourbon. Nice on the palate. Damn good beer!

Draft at Jerrys.  Black with scant, brown head (barrel-aged) / Rich, earthy, complex nose of tobacco, coffee, chocolate, and just a hint of cherry / Medium to full body, moderately tart, some chew with good balance and light bitter finish / Flavors of roast coffee, cherry, semisweet chocolate, caramel, and a hint of bourbon barrel  / Flavor doesnt quite live up to the nose, but this seems a leap above regular Bells cherry stout.

Had on tap at Mad Mex.  Pour is jet black with creamy caramel head. Nose is strong cherry, light roast, some dry chocolate, and noce balance of woody bourbon. Taste is the same, cherry forward with some roasted malt and rich chocolate balancing. The bourbon is interwoven very gently towards the back adding subtle depth.  Body is thick and creamy, not heavy. Assertive carbonation and very smooth. Light wood notes come out as it warms more towards the forefront.

Sample at Fobab.  Very dark stout witha tan head.  Aroma has cherry and bourbon, with the cherry dominating.  Taste is more of the same, lots of cherrys and a little bit of bourbon with some stout flavors mixed in. A little to heavy on the cherry side, I didnt think it balanced right.

Dark pour with a small tan head on draft at Republic. Nose is subtle - malty and oaky. The taste though, the taste is like the Kool-Aid man just crashed through the wall. Tart cherry, malty sweetness gives way to a nice bourbon warming. Very nice!!

November 19, 2012 on tap at Busters. Dark pour with large tan head. Aroma was a big blast of the bourbon and the cherry came out as well. Might have been some roasted malt in there. Taste was delicious bourbon with sweetness, a mild alcohol burn that I like, some roastyness and finished with a tart cherry. Smooth and a medium to full body. Just amazing what bourbon can do for a beer!

Awesome pour with over an inch and a half of thick, foamy head.  Great cherry aroma with bourbon notes.  strong tart flavor is mellowed by the sweetness of the barrels.  A nice fill mouhfeel that leaves you tasting like you downed a handful of cherries.

Draft. On at Busters on 28th. Pours a dark black with a light tan head that collars around the glass. Smells a lot like the normal version; dark fruit and slight roast. Heavy mouthfeel. Dark fruit with slight bourbon. Not that much different than the regular version.
Another bells beer that is good on its own but great when thrown into barrels. The tartness and bourbon blend well here.

Draft at Novemberfest at Rustico last weekend. Poured a dark brown color with a small tan head. Aroma was tart cherries, with notes of vanilla and wood. Flavor was nice woody, roasty malts, with notes of cherry. Quite a quaffable brew for its 8.5%. Pretty enjoyable - would like to find a bottle of this one.
On tap. Pours very dark with no head. Not much in terms of aroma. Flavor is a slightly tart cherry with caramel, malts and chocolate. Definitely a little boozy but quite good.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2012 Tap at eccentric

S: Lots of bourbon, cherry, and rich stout.  The cherry and bourbon brings a manhattan to mind, which is fantastic
A: Dark, dark, dark brown with ruby red on the fringes.  Small, barrel tan head
T: Tart from the cherries, sweet from the bourbon, bitter from the chocolate and coffee.  Just amazing
P: A little thin, but works well
O: holy god yes, what a pleasant surprise
On draft at rustico. Pours slmost black with a tsn head. Oak dominates the nose. Tart pie cherries mellowed by vanilla from the oak. Nice.

On tap at the Eccentric Cafe. Pours a black body with a thin, creamy, brown head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is bourbon with a somewhat tart cherry alongside a good amount of chocolate and roasts. Touches of vanilla and wood with a hint of toffee sweetness. Flavor is similar. Bourbon and wood up front before a rich dark chocolate and nice, somewhat tart cherry comes in. Some roasts increase a bit towards the end with touches of vanilla and toffee as this finishes clean, lightly tart, and roasty with a nice bourbon note. Lengthy aftertaste following medium body and a light carbonation. Overall, a really solid barrel aged beer. Great bourbon presence with a really nice tart cherry, roast, and rich chocolate. This was great.
Tap. Black with small head. Cherry tart and light bourbon. Flavors really meld well. Very well done.

Thanks to the big man from the great state of Michigan been wanting to try this one since I came in to the site the aroma us if cherries up front and in your face the pour is black and thin only because its a stout not an imperial stout other aromas are oak and vanillians the taste is sweet of cherries the tart from that little red fruit being batch 7777 it has aged gracefully Im not a big fan of regular cheery stout but this is one damn good beer that I hope to have again someday thanks Jeff

12 oz. bottle of unknown age (probably a few years old), generously bonusd by northernbrews (thanks a lot, Jeff). Pours black with a reddish tinge and a small beige head. Aroma brings out the cherry on top, boozified by the bourbon barrels, with notes of oak and liqueur - basically like a sweet cherry liqueur. Flavour is a fair bit tart due to the cherries, with some mild bourbon coming through, but is almost completely outdone by the tart cherry juice. There is no booze to be detected - perhaps age has concealed it. Medium-bodied, with the tartness becoming more and more prominent with each successive sip. Not sure a whole 12 oz. bottle of this is warranted for one person drinking it - wouldve rather split it. Anyway, not really my type of stout due to the sourness (not a good combination to me).

Bottle shared by ygtbsm94. Thanks Brad! Ive been wanting to try this one for a couple years now.

Batch 7777.

The beer is a deep, dark brown with minimal head. The aroma brings a lot of barrel characteristics, with a subtle fruitiness from the cherries. The flavor is excellent, and right away I am impressed with the balance of the beer and cohesiveness of all the flavors. The cherries are not incredibly forward, though they are present. Instead, they play a supporting role and meld beautifully into the overall profile. The feel is smooth, with alcohol content quite subdued, likely do to four years of aging. Plenty of good carbonation still exists. Overall, a really tasty brew. I definitely recommend it.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-13-2011

Bottle thanks to Armin.  Thanks a bunch! Pour is dark brown, no head.  Aroma is sweet chocolate, light wood, some fruit.  Taste is much more than the aroma lets on, with lots of chocolate malts, some caramel, a fair bit of brown sugar, and lots of cherry fruit.  Mouthfeel is fairly thick.  Quite nice, not showing the age at all.  Thanks Armin!
Bottle.  Very dark chocolate pour, almost no carbonation and a strong sweet dark cherry nose.  Flavor is very sweet dark cherry, dark chocolate, some peat and boozy on the finish.

Pour out of 12 oz bottle, big thanks to Mark for the bottle! Dark oily black pour with thin to no head, aroma has notes of big bourbon, cherry, big bakers chocolate, toffee, some nice roast and dark fruit, molasses notes as well.  Pretty sweet and thick smelling.  Taste is big sweet cherry, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, oak, some nice dark chocolate, slightly acidic malts, more cherry notes going into bakers chocolate, slight roast, molasses and toffee, sweet finish.

A good beer, not a great beer. I didnt get enough of the barrel-aged/bourbon aspects that I had expected. Skewed more to the sourness of the cherries - kept it from being balanced. But I enjoyed it. I am biased towards the guys at Bells - they do an awesome job. Iwould buy this one again - just not blown away by it.

Bottle with pat, Dallas, and Tom. Pours a deep black body with no head. Aroma is sweet sour cherries, dark chocolate and molasses. Mouthfeel is medium to thin with notes of sour cherry, roasted malts, dark chocolates, oat, and wood.
Pours dark with dark cherry red thin head with little retention. Malty aroma with cherry and hints of bourbon and sour cream.  Tart cherry flavor with roast malt notes.
Bottle with friends. Pours a pitch perfect black. Smell is like frozen cherries. This is essentially an expedition stout with cherries. Cherries balance perfectly with the vanilla from the barrels.

Served way too cold at UNO Chicago Grill. Almost a sour with cherry juice prominent. Served under proper conditions, I think this might have promise.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from 12oz bottle.  Pours dark brown, nearly black with just some reddish edges.  Aroma is a bit of bourbon and tart cherries.  Taste is very similar.  The tartness of the cherry juice was overwhelming.  The cherry taste was too artificial.

Bottle courtesy of Doodler (BIG thanks Scott!) poured a clear dark reddish brown nearly black with a small lingering reddish brown head. Aromas of bourbon, cherry, oak, bitter chocolate, light roastiness and light vanilla. Palate was medium tro full bodied and smooth with a tart finish. Flavors of cherry, bourbon, dark chocolatelight oak and light roastiness with a smooth tart lingering cherry finish.

Got this from my Secret Santa last year.  Very generous!  This pours a near black color with a short-lived dark brown head.  Strong whiffs of bourbon with cherry puree, chocolate, oak, and leather.  As the case with Bells regular Cherry Stout, I dont particularly care for the cherry flavors here.  The use of cherry juice, or whatever it is, gives it an artificial taste.  However, the bourbon and chocolate are really good here and end up pairing pretty well with the tartness from the cherries.  Underlying notes of oak mix in.  Overall I enjoyed it, much better than the regular Cherry Stout, which I didnt like at all.

31st May 2009Opaque black stout. Smooth start to the palate but there is a trailing carbonated bite. A complex brew! Maraschino cherry, vanilla oak, a little bourbon and sourish chocolate. All well joined up. Overall a sweet tasting beer with many different aspects.

Bottle from at least 2 years ago.  Pour is black with a deep sanguine brown head.  Aroma is loaded with roasted malt and tons of cherries. Also hints of vanilla, bourbon, and light alcohol.  Flavor is really impressive.  Lots of vanilla, cherry cream, roasted malt, light bourbon, and a smooth full cherry-vanilla finish.  Do not like the base beer, but wow was this good.

Bottle thanks to a generous trader (Northernbrews?). Pours black. Brown head. Nose/taste of sweet cherries, pie crust, roast chocolate malts and vanilla. I didnt get much barrel, but the beer is excellent the way it is. Full body for a sweet stout.

Thanks to ygtbsm94 for opening this bottle. Batch 7777 served in a Bruery tulip.

Pours a very dark brown with a minimal off white head. THe nose has a lot of the barrel character plus loads of cherries and a bit of vanilla. Bourbon and oak are highly prevalent. The bourbon dances with the cherry quite beautifully in the flavor department. Really nice interplay between all the flavors with the oak and vanilla playing a nice supporting role. Medium body and low carbonation. This one came onto my radar recently, and I was quite fortunate in having it poured right in front of me by the ever-generous Brad.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-12-2011

Bottle courtesy of Styles. Pours an opaque black in my tulip glass with no discernable head. Aroma is a nice blend of roasty chocolate, with hints of bourbon, and cherries. Body is medium. Flavor is again roasty chocolate with hints of the bourbon & cherries. Very smooth, but left a lingering buttery aftertase. Other than the finish, id have rated it much higher

12oz traded bottle Batch 7777 which makes it just over 4 years old now! Nice, almost black pour with a lively brown head. Solid carbonation. The aroma is quite simply: bourbon and meaty, black cherries with just a hint of vanilla. Big flavor that really hits hard with sweet-sour cherry notes and the booze. Really no hint of the 8.5 ABV until it warms your belly. Enjoyable and has held up really nicely so far.

Bottle acquired via trade with motortoddhead...trade with this man!!!  Beautiful blend of dark chocolate, tart Bing cherries, oak, smooth bourbon, vanilla, and caramel.  This adds so much complexity to their traditional Cherry Stout...absolutely takes it to a whole new level.  Medium mouthfeel. Ive been wanting to try this one for a while!!!

Tasted blind side by side with Central Waters same beer.  Comparisons are between the two glasses.  Dark ring.  Nose beautiful.  Cherry and malt.  Great cherry taste.  Lots and lots of cherry, with the bitterness of light roastiness.  Dark fruit way in the back.  No ring after a minute, and zero carbonation.  Heavier pour than CW.
Thnx Daknole for this one. Black colored brew. Dark chocolate and roast in the aroma. Some cherries and bourbon. Flavor about the same. Pleasant mix of flavors.

Bottled, thx to Noize. Dark color, short head. Aroma of dark chocolat, roasted malt, lovely bourbon. And then also some fruity cherries kick in. For me these are strange combinations, big RIS, bourbon BA and fruit. Most likely because I dont see those combis that often around here. But although the distinct flavors are clearly present, the beer is nicely balanced and each sip surprises again. The cherry is not overdone, and gives the heavy bourbon BA RIS a sweet and fruity edge, but also in some way makes it refreshing and more easy drinkable (which can be a killer combo though). While Im rating it, I still feel it banging my head from yesterday evening ;-)

Bottle: Poured a deep pitch-black color stout with a small dirty brown foamy head with good retention and minimal lacing. Aroma of semi-sweet cherry juice with roasted malt notes and loads of black chocolate notes as well. Taste is also a nice balance mix between some semi-sweet cherry juice (taste like real cherry and not some fake syrup) with loads of black chocolate malt notes and a light dry roasted malt finish. Oak was not to apparent. Body is quite full with good carbonation for style with no apparent alcohol. I usually dont like so much sweetness in my stout but this one was interesting enough.

Bottle courtesy Sean.  Lucky batch 7,777.  I smell sugary cherry on top of light bourbon and the combination seems to create a whiff of sour but its minimal.  Clear chocolate and cherry flavor right up front in the taste.  Sweet malt underneath, more light bourbon, and a sour tinge with alcohol on the finish.  Taste leans heavily on the fruit and not stout side of the combination.  As the beer warms the cherry and bourbon come out a bit more.  Unique beer and Im certainly happy to have enjoyed a bottle.
RBSG Tasting. Cherry still smells fake (like its reg little bro). It needs more time is my first guess (a la little bro). Molasses, caramel choocolate in the aroma.

Bottle at RBSG, I believe on the bus to the Festival. Pours a deep brown, translucent at the edges. thin tan head. Nose is vanilla and tart cherries. Actually, the cherries in this one balance well with the smokey oak notes of the barrel. A very cherry cobbler type flavor permeates with some of the coconut that you get from the barrel as well. Clean enough finish. The acidity of the cherries work well, but the body is a bit thin.

Bottle at RBSG 2010. Pours deep brown, thin tan head, poor/spotty lacing. Nose is cherries (maraschinos???) and bourbon, creamy roast character present as well, also chocolate. Flavours of tart chocolate-covered cherries, spice, and oak. Good.

You arent getting a different flavor from the hop at 30min as opposed to 5min, you are just getting less of it. I liked it, not too much bourbon, the cherry was quite marachino-esque, good base stout. quite nice.

Draft @ FoBAB 2009, Chicago, IL. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a sweetish roasted malty chocolate and cherry aroma with some hints of bourbon. Sweetish roasted malty chocolate and cherry flavor with hints of vanilla and bourbon. Has a roasted malty chocolate and cherry vanilla finish.

Location: Bottle at Max and Andys Fantasy Tasting, 5/1/10


Aroma: It has chocolate, cherry, wood, bourbon, and vanilla on the nose

Appearance: It has a black pour with a tan head

Flavor: Flavor has some sweetness, oak, cherry, booze, and a bit of sourness

Palate: The body is medium-full with relatively low carbonation and a good mouthfeel

Overall Impression: 
This is a pretty good beer.  The flavors are not completely overwhelmed by the bourbon barreling.  I dont always this barrel aging makes a beer better, but it works pretty well in this one.
Bottle at Max and Andys Fantasy Tasting. - this is damn tasty. Fruity yet roasty, coffee, cocoa and creamy with some tart notes. medium bodied.
Black beer strong burbound cherry aroma . meduim sweet flavor sharp alcohol. finishes with  strong cherry

12oz bottle courtesy of @weeheavysd and @bikesandbeers, poured into 4oz beer tasters.  Pours thick with a thin head that develops and then fades away quickly (no legs).  The aroma is super intense, like a blast of my favorite port.  The bourbon comes out truer in the flavor, though.  Its a little hot, but otherwise the flavor and palate are very nice.  Smooth and sweet up front, with a tart, hot kick in the back of the throat.  I dont think I could drink more than a few ounces, but man those few ounces are fun.

Bottle at Andy and Maxs fantasy tasting.  Pours a deep dark black with vague hints of a dark tan head.  Nice bourbon and sweet old cherries, lots of vanilla and a hint of chocolate.  Sweet, a little tart, touches of old fruit, a bit of vanilla.  Finishes up with some roast bitterness.
Jet black pour with decent tan head.  Nose is fantastic cherry pie.  Flavor is miraculous blend of tart dark cherries and rich milk chocolate.  Amazing.  Thanks james!!!

12oz bottle pours a opaque black with one ring of beige head.  At first I thought the aroma smelled like sweat socks... but I realized that what I was smelling was the combo of cherry and vanilla.  It smells better than it sounds.  Flavor is sweet, cherry, toasted malts, vanilla, coconut, wood pulp.  Full bodied, wet finish.

almost perfect. pours black with medium-sized brown head. aroma of oak,bourbon,chocolate, tart cherry and lactose. creamy, dense palate covers the entire mouth. the tart cherry flavor from their basic cherry stout is still evident in this version as well. the bourbon/oak is in perfect balance with the base of the beer, and a cream-like lactose component adds a great touch to the already stellar cherry stout. as usual, bells created a beer that becomes elite with bourbon aging
What a great candidate for barrel aging.  Dark brown, 3 bubble head, scant lacing.  Aroma of brandied/candied chocolate covered cherries.  Taste is similar with a nice sourness.  A winner.

Bottle.  A black beer with a small creamy tan head.  Nose is primary bourbon, cherry, and chocolate, secondary roast, vanilla, raisin, and wood.  Medium body with a smooth mouth feel and soft carbonation.  Moderately sweet flavor is big on bourbon, chocolate, and cherry with lesser notes of vanilla and wood.  Finishes lightly acidic.

Bottle from Silphium...thanks Brad! - Pours nice and dark with a small tan head. The cherry has held up pretty well--its smooth and sweet and still has a bit of oak sharpness. The taste seems to have fallen off a bit. Everything is pretty muted and a bit flat. Theres lots of caramel and a bit of sweet bourbon, with the cherry and oak coming in on the finish. Its smooth, bubbly, and a beer that I wish I could have tried a year ago.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2013 12 oz. bottle via trade with daknole- thanks, Dak!  Batch 7777.  Pours a deep brown, mostly opaque with some tan highlights on the edges, some visible carbonation, and a small head that falls somewhere between tan and brown.  The bourbon barrel pops most in the aroma- bourbon, vanilla, oak, molasses, earth, and cherries.  The cherries come out more in the flavor than in the nose, but the bourbon notes arent any less- bourbon, vanilla, molasses, tart cherries, chocolate, dirt, and wood.  Medium-bodied with more carbonation than I remember from the regular Cherry Stout and a boozy vanilla finish.  I enjoyed the cherry stout a lot, and thought the tartness and roastiness balanced well.  Throw in the barrel aging and its kind of a mess- sweet, tart, boozy, buttery, earthy- of just too much going on.  For that reason, Ive got the Cherry Stout rated a notch higher even though this is the higher-rated beer on here by far. Re-Rate: better than remembered. Big sweet bourbon barrel nose. Balanced. Tasty.

12oz bottle, thanks ryan!  Pours pitch black with a light tan head.  Nose is really nice, lots of bourbon aroma, but without any harsh alcohol to go along with it.  Also has a nice subtle undercurrent of cherries in the smell.   Taste has lots of bourbon, roast, sweetness balanced well by tart cherries.  Fades nicely into cherries.  Very nice, the bourbon is predominant without punching you in the face.
Black pour with tan head and lace. Whisky, with a hint of cherries alot of oak and abv. Cherries, BB, abv, with a light sour finish. Silky full bodied beer. very nice

Pours red black. Nose is bourbon and nothing else really going on. Has a red ring to it. Abover average fizz. No head to it. Taste like bourbon and cherry tartness and nothing else. Disappointing for its high ratings. I thought the regular version had more going on.

Pre-KTG day with jblauvs and otey. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma holds massive sweet cherry, lactic sugars, yogurt, marzipan, and chocolate. Flavor is very strange; lots of lactic sweetness, maraschino cherry, and yogurt. Finish is really nice and dry, but the flavor is just so weird. Not bad, but cant rate it highly.

A: The pour is a dark, dark brown (you could easily call it black) with a nice (but thin) tan head on top.

S: The nose is very interesting on this beer. Theres the obvious stout components of chocolate, roasted malt and coffee, but the cherries provide a slight tartness to the nose that works amazingly well with the rich roasted and bourbon aromas.

T: The flavor profile is unlike any other beer Ive had. The cherries are slightly tart (not sour), and interact in such an interesting with the chocolate, roasted malt, and bourbon.

M: The body is medium to full with a low level of carbonation.

D: This is really a different beer, but an absolutely delicious one. The cherries are not sour, but they do provide a touch of tartness to cut through the rich flavors of the base beer and the barrel characteristics.

Suttrees Nothing else to do in Mid-February Tasting. Sample from a bottle thanks to Suttree.  Dark brown, tan head.  Bourbon aroma, wood, chocolate.  Taste is vanilla, bourbon, cherry, very sweet, light roast.

PreKTG day tasting with oteyj and craftycarl.  
Aroma is sweet cherries, some lactic notes, bit of chocolate cream and vanilla.  Flavor is Incredibly sweet cherry and lactic sugar.  Rather one dimensional and a little odd.   finish is nice and dry.  Interesting, but overall just not my style

Dead black pour with a nice frothy tan head. The aroma is hugely sweet cherry, lactic sugars, yogurt, and some subtle roast. I dont get too much barrel. The flavor is tart cherry with very sweet caramel, and lots of lactic sugars. Very one dimensional, but tasty and interesting. the palate is medium bodied with pillowy effervescence and a very dry finish. Unique and interesting.

12oz bottle @Suttrees Nothing else to do TN Gathering.  Thanks Phil-pours a dissipating brown head and black coloe.  Aroma is bourbon, cherry, dark malt-roasty/wood/chickory.  Taste is bourbon, cherry, dark malt-licorice/roasty/wood/chickory.  Finishes fairly sweet, vanilla.

Yknow, Ive grown weary of the whole bourbon barrel aging thing. I see that a perfectly good beer has been stuck in a bourbon barrel and I kinda sigh and shrug and say "whatever dude". But then ever so often I try something like this that really gets my attention- its perfectly blended, and the bourbon doesnt overpower, and actually mels really well with the cherry and chocolate in the beer. Nice stuff. Thanks, Secret Santa!

"Incredible mix of heavy roasted stout, mildly tart dark cherries, wood and bourbon. Dark viscous body with a dark, frothy head and spotty lacing. Great scent of tobacco, cherry, burnt toast and cocoa. Flavor follows suit and allows the wood and bourbon to pull through. Fantastic, levels above their Cherry Stout."

Courtesy of Nbutler11, thanks Nick! Its black with a small, creamy and dark brown head. The aroma has notes of cherries, bourbon, raisin, vanilla, wood and slightly roasted malt. The flavour has a light sweetness and notes of raisin, wood, cherries and berry acidity, bourbon, vanilla and caramel. Its different from most, and the typical stout/porter notes are subdued by cherries, bourbon and wood.

batch 7777 courtesy of coyotehunter, thanks!  black pour with thin brown foam. lots of bourbon on the nose, but not nearly as much on the palate. lots of cherry, especially in the finish. nice rendition, the barrels def did wonders for the base cherry stout.

355mL courtesy of Santa! Pours jet black with a menacing thin, super dark brown head that leaves spotty lacing and has a good protective layer that persists. Aroma is superb: buttery, rich mellowed out bourbon, barrel notes, Chambord, booze, port wine. Woah. Taste is dichotomous: there is rich spicy, bourbon, oak, roasted notes juxtaposed with sour cherries, some kriek lambic sourness. Medium carbonation. A bit spritzy on the palate. This beer pretty much kicks ass.

(Sample Date: 7/18/2009   Source:Other)   Courtesy of Dkatchur. Roast whiskey and oak aroma. Black with a small tan head. Deep dark fruit notes in flavorraisin, cherry and slightly tart. Whiskey and oak with light astringency. Tongue warming. Surprising amount of tart cherry sourness. Tasty.

12 oz bottle.  Pours near oily black with a glowing orange fizzy head. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, cherry juice, lots of sweet caramel, cherry coke, toffee, leather earth and lots of sugary sweetness- some roaszt and nutty chocolate.  Sweet cherry juice flavor, good bourbon, vanilla oakiness, roast with some coffee, barrel, woody, cherry pit, sweet but not cloying- and a smooth finish.
Im a fan and I am glad I got a chance to try this at FoBAB.  Pours black.  Aroma and flavor of wood, boozy, chocolate, vanilla, and some tart cherries.  Well done.

Bottled. A pitch black beer with a brown head. The aroma has notes of cherries, wood, and alcohol - like a cherry liquor. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of roasted malt, wood, and cherries, leading to a bone dry kriek-like finish. Thanks Papsoe for sharing.

The Dan Journal #303.  Tasted 9/14/09 with Keir (2 down) and others.  12oz bottle.  Batch 7777.  Bottled Nov 10 2008.  Dark and opaque.  Ring of dark Khaki head.  Aromas of vanilla, chocolate and dark cherries.  No real surprise there.  Subtle smokey note.  Full bodied with a total tart cherry flavor.  Vanilla woody flavor from the barrel aging.  Very tart.  The chocolate and coffee flavors from the base stout is well overshadowed byt the tart esters.  Well crafted and a true treat to finally get to sample.
FOBAB 2009-  pours a deep brown with a small tan head.  notes of bourbon, cherry, toast, mold, earth.  wood.  A  chocolate, cherry, bourbon, cream, booze, vanilla mix.  like it or leave it.
Batch 7777.  Pours dark --black with very thin head.  Nose is deep bourbon, sugary, and alcohol.  Taste is tart, subtle cherry flavor, mild bourbon.  Dry on the palate.

Sampled from 12-oz bottle and shared by BDR during Darkness Day 2009 in Brooklyn Center, MN. Pours a semi-clear dark brown colored brew with a thin tan head that dissipates to a film top. Aroma of bourbon and tart cherries with a hint of toasted dark malt and chocolate. Taste is medium to full bodied, thin carbonation with flavors of bourbon, vanilla, tart cherries and chocolate. Finish continues the bourbon presence, some some cherry aftertaste that slowly disappears.

Shared by BDR.  I smell butter in the aroma, but also bourbon.  Flavor has less sour cherry than the original, which I dont think is a good thing.  It also has bourbon, and that doesnt help the beer either.  Carbonation is lower.  The cherry flavor is still there.  While I would say many great beers are ruined by bourbon, this is still good, but much different.

12 oz bottle shared by beastiefan2k. Batch 7777 marked on the bottle, meaning this was bottled on November 10, 2008. Pour is deepest brown with ruby highlights and a 1/2 inch tan head that falls fast. Aroma of Bourbon, wood resin, alcohol - thats about it. Taste is big malt cherry dark skin fruit (dried sweetness without the tart or sour), followed by mild bourbon (much more tame in the taste), and then a brief char roastiness to the end. This brief roastiness is the only indication that this is based on a stout.  Palate is flat for the most part, alcohol is subdued, some licorice peeking through and the longish finish. This beer was done well enough, I suppose, just not entirely my thing.

Thanks to ucusty for this gem! Pours dark brown/black with a small dark brown head. The aroma is of bourbon, wood, vanilla, chocolate, and cherry. The flavor is tart up front with berry and cherry flavors giving way to a smoother bourbon and wood feel. Not too overpowering with the barrel flavors, which is good. Very sublte, yet extremely tasty. Almost like drinking liquid cherry pie. Interesting and well balanced flavors. This is what every barrel aged beer should be.

12oz Bottle courtesy of dkachur at Immys Backyard Throwdown, Batch 7777. Pours black in color with brown head. Aroma in the face cherries and bourbon. Taste bourbon, cherries, roasted malt and chocolate with bitter finish.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a small sized head of foamy fine to medium sized brown colored bubbles that were and left behind a opaque black colored body and a fair lacing. The aroma was dark malt bourbon and cherry. The mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start mediumly tingly at the finish. The mild flavor contained notes of cherry dark malt and bourbon. Delicious and one I would certainly buy again.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2009 12 oz. bottle - thanks BVC!! ymmm, smells like chocolate cherry pie; dark brown with trace tan head; a tasty, thin bodied sweet stout; lots of chocolate, cherry, brown sugar and vanilla; silky smooth and mildly rich; kind of like cookies or cranberry bread; very tasty

Shared with hapjydeuce a while back.  Black pour with no real sustaining head to speak of.  Tart aroma of cherries with hints of chocolate covered coffee beans.  The cherries and light carbonation give it an interesting mouthfeel.  The initial flavor is of soft wood and chocolate.  It isnt until the aftertase that the cherries and coffee accents really push through.  Very complex flavor.  Im pretty bummed I only had 1 bottle.  great stuff

Nearly black pour but you can tell theres cherry in it if you look closely. has a nice but small tan head. Yep, cherries in the aroma, but not like the regular version. They are a bit more subdued here and have more chocolate overtones. Its fairly sweet with lots of malt, but its balanced out by some woody flavour and a bit of roast. Cherry is there, again subdued. Its really much better balanced than the regular version but I still feel like the cherry ruins the stout a bit.

( 12oz bottle thanks to ballewblake, batch 7777) Pours black with orange edges and coats the glass like oil in the process. Nose is chocolate covered cherries, smoky, coffee. Taste is syrupy, coffee, artificial cherry, very sweet. Finishes smoky, more of the syrup, and unsweetened chocolate.

Bottle shared by shigadeyo.

Poured dark reddish brown color with a large frothy brown head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy toasted chocolate malt, cherry and sweet woody bourbon aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted malt and bourbon bing chery flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to long duration.

Standout brew that exceeded my expectations.

12oz bottle, batch #7777, via trade at DLD. pours a slightly oily, very dark brown, nearly black with definite glints of red and a thin, dark tan head with light lacing. aroma is excellent with huge notes of bourbon and vanilla initially that slowly calm revealing notes of tart cherry, dark chocolate, ashy wood, and roasty malt. flavor is absolutely delicious with huge notes of tart cherries dipped in dark chocolate, some sweeter, vinous red fruits, vanilla, and sweet toffee backed by huge oaked bourbon, roast coffee, and tobacco with a long, charred oak finish with a twang of cherry. palate is medium bodied but quite rich with solid carbonation. overall, another great stout from bells.

Bottle courtesy of dkachur on 07/18/2009. Dark black body with a medium creamy tan head. Big bourbon and cherry aroma with lots of woodiness and fruit. Sweet cherry and wood flavor. Medium body with moderately low carbonation.

Bottle.  Thanks to alexsdad06 at NATIFEST.  Poured a dark mocha with a very thin tan head.  Aroma is roasted malts, bourbon, and sweet cherries.  Notes of oak, alcohol, vanilla, and dark chocolate are hidden in it as well.  The palate is smooth and rich.  In the flavor, the cherry stands out at first, but everything in the aroma gets amplified as it sits on the pallate.  The finish is dry.  I really enjoyed this one.  Not a favorite by any means, but one I would love to drink again.

Batch 7777
8/01/2009:  Bells Bourbon Barrel Aged Cherry Stout... Aroma:  Super fragrant (aroma is detectable from several feet away!); cherry-like balsamic; bourbon.  Appearance:  Black with large foamy brown head.  Flavor:  Tons of sugary/caramelized malts, chocolate, subtle slightly tart cherry, rye-like bourbon, dry and charred-wood finish.  Palate:  Medium-full body, very smooth.  Overall:  Really, really nice; massive arom and flavor, definitely packing some alcohol, very impressive.

12 fl. oz. bottle shared by alexsdad06 at NATIFEST 09.  Thanks Brad!  Rating #206 for this beer.

I wasnt a huge fan of the Cherry Stout beer to begin with, as I thought it lacked any cherry character to begin with.  This beer followed the same thing, except now its got a huge bourbon character in both the aroma and flavor which bumps it up a few levels.

The beer pours out an inky black color, coating my glass with a molasses-like color and a 1" creamy brown head.  Aroma is clearly bourbon dominant, with lots of wood, toffee, light smoke, vanilla and dark chocolate.  Flavor is full-on bourbon like someone poured a quick shot in my bottle.  Oak flavors, vanilla, tart malt/fruit (although I couldnt get cherry, but could see the association of tartness with the cherries), Red Vines and a bit of tobacco.  Very enjoyable beer and erases the memory of the Cherry Stout from my mind.

12oz bottle courtesy of armchairboogie poured into a tulip.

Pours opaque black in the glass with a big bubbly mocha head that dissipates pretty quickly to a solid ring and leaves only patchy lacing.

The aroma is basically bourbon-soaked cherries dipped in chocolate.  The cherries are slightly tart with lots of dark chocolate sweetness.  The bourbon is not overpowering but definitely present.

The taste starts out with a big blast of tart and sweet cherries.  Its definitely got more of a sour kick than the aroma.  The backbone is sweet, dark roasted malts.  Theres only a hint of bourbon in the finish and the taste is definitely bigger on cherries than the aroma.

The mouthfeel is slick and medium to full-bodied with a soft carbonation that leaves the palate sticky with cherry sweetness with a hint of puckering tartness, though just a touch.

This is a very nice cherry stout that has plenty of body and stout character, but its the cherries that really make the taste stand out.  Another great stout from Bells.

Bottle courtesy of dkachur at Immys Backyard Throwdown. Batch 7777 (bottled January 2, 2007). Aroma smacks me in the face with a bourbon hammer. Dark brown pours with a short tan head. Through the bourbon I can pick up some maple, oak, and caramel. Hints of vanilla as well. Taste is strong bourbon, too, along with tart fruits, roasted malt, oak, and vanilla. Thick bodied and chewy with more tartness from the cherries. Ends with more cherry, bourbon, of course and vanilla. Rather tasty but a bit overpowering with the tartness. More so than the regular Cherry Stout.

12 oz. bottle shared by dkachur at Immys Backyard Throwdown.  Batch 7777 (bottled January 2, 2007).  Ive had regular Cherry Stout before and its a decent beer.  I probably like it better than most people.  That being said, this one blows that out of the water.  Pours dark brown to black with a thin beige head.  Strong bourbon aroma with a hint of cherry.  Wonderful taste of sour cherry, vanilla, and chocolate.  Warm alcohol burn on the finish.  This one was great.  Thanks again to dkachur for letting us try this.

Bottle shared by dkachur at Immys Backyard Throwdown. This was batch 777. Strong smell of bourbon. There is a slight cherry taste, as well as a roasted coffee and bourbon. I overall enjoyed this and will drink it again.

The 200th rating of this beer. Hooray! 12 ounce bottle from mibirder. Thanks! Shared at Immys Backyard Throwdown. Pours a reddish brown color with a thin head. Fair head retention and lacing. Big bourbon aroma with peppery wood notes. The cherry does not show up much here. The taste is strong bourbon and strong cherries. Sadly its some decent bourbon over the same cherry stout I cant stand. Full bodied and quite tart. Decent even I dont like it.

Bottle at home ... Thank to WeeHeavySD for this and BBB3 for delivery ... Deep black with think brown lacing ... lots of cherry and bourbon on Nose ... oh yeah my wife is right ... its strange ... but nice ... some chocolate ... definite bourbon ... and loads more cherry than i would have expected... So much i wonder if there syrup in here as well ... little vanilla ...quite sweet ... very OTT

Batch 7777.  Opaque black with a quickly dissipating tan head.  Aroma of bourbon, dark malts, vanilla, oak and some of the cherry sneaks through as well.  Taste of cherry, mild bourbon, vanilla, dark malts.  Smooth with some mild alcohol burn  on par, perhaps just a step below the regular cherry stout.

Batch 7777 thanks to coyotehunter. Pours with a black body and a dark brown head atop. Aroma of bourbon, cherry pie, red wine, chocolate and currants. Taste is red wine, port, currants, chocolate, oak, cinnamon and red licorice. Thickish mouthfeel. Light carbonation. Wonderfully different.

#2700 Bottle.  Pours a black body with a tan coffee roast head.  Almost sour cherry vinegar notes in the aroma, some oak and chocolate malt and some vanilla and bourbon.  Cherry and some acidic fruit, chocolate and coffee roast with a mild etoh warming.  Odd it reminds me of a sour more than anything.  Good shit!

Pours pitch black with a minimal tanish head and low carbonation.  Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, cherry, oak, tabacco.  Everything I love about a stout, thick and creamy mouthfeel, bourbon, vanilla, cherry, everything in this is over the top.  I love it.
Another old rating. Aroma of bourbon and chocolate. Flavor was sweet. Only getting a  little bit of cherry and some light bourbon notes.

12oz bottle courtesy of iceicebaby. Pours a menacing dark, muddy black color with a one finger tan foamy head that settles quickly but laces the glass nicely. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of bourbon, chocolate, brown sugar, molasses, caramel, some hints of ripe dark fruit and cherries. Flavor is tart with notes of cherry, chocolate, brown sugar, bourbon, syrupy, light roast, some hints of vanilla and wood. Generally medium to full body with a pleasing tart cherry malt finish.

12 oz bottle courtesy of TheEpeeist, shared with my girlfriends brother. Pours a near black dark brown nearly opaque pour with small dark brown head that clings to the glass. Aromas throw some decent bourbon and barrel character, roasted malts, and light tart cherry. Initial is bourbon, a bit of warm booziness off the bat, oak and vanilla, roasted malts, moving into a tart cherry on the backend. Tannins throw in some bitterness and tartness on the backend, some subtle chocolate in the roast, coffee, some oak. Overall a nice experience, but I prefered the cherry stout base beer more. Cheers!

(Bottle via trade with pantanap, thanks Kan!) Pours very dark brown with a thin almost reddish brown head that recedes to mostly just the edges. Aroma of molasses, wood, bourbon, vanilla and cherry. Mouthfeel is oaky-smooth, very lightly fizzy, a little sticky on back end. Light syrupy film coats the inside of the snifter with some very fine rings that melt way quickly. Smooth flavor of molasses, cherry, wood, vanilla, bourbon and dark bakers chocolate. Not quite as complex-tasting as it sounds but still quite tasty. All flavors nicely integrated. ABV well-covered. Nice.

Bottle. Pitch black with a creamy foreverlasting light brown head. Fantastic. Slight bourbon and vanilla aroma with a little roasted character. Sweet cherries in the background. The flavour is acidic cherries, roasted malt, bourbon, alcohol, vanilla and wood. Quite complex brew. Medium bodied. Interesting and challenging beer.

12 oz. bottle @ DLD 09, from a chap who actually worked at Bells when they brewed this single-batch curiosity; poured a clear, pitch black w/ a modest tan head; aroma was heavy in bourbon, cherry juice, and roasted malt; flavor was heavy w/ acidic cherry sourness, warming alcohol, vanilla and a mild metallic note; medium bodied, ending smooth and slightly tart; an interesting take on the Cherry Stout, which is a lovely beer in itself. Much appreciated Brent!

12oz bottle. Wow... Ive had bottles of the Cherry Stout with 2+ years on them, and theyve been great. Ive never had a bourbon barreled beer from Bells, but they appear to do them quite well. This beer, however was an absolute mess. Aroma of molasses, rotting wood, plenty of soy, alcohol, a bit of charred malt, wet, rotting wood, musty cherry juice... ugh. Pours a thick, impenetrable dark brown with a creamy and quickly dissolving dark khaki head. Flavor is just as messy as the aroma. Boozy cherry liqueur, assloads of offputting wood tannin, charred malt, vanilla extract.  A bit of bitter chocolate, more molasses, soy sauce, fusel alcohol. Palate entry is initially rather thick and relatively creamy but by the finish the beer becomes watery and totally boozy. Finishes with a very brash tannic wood note and plenty of alcohol hotness. Thanks Eben! (oops)!

Bottle.  Pour was thick and dark with a nice tan head.  Aroma was a bit weird for it smelled like wet wood with some cherries.  Real potent but not very enjoyable. Flavor, however, made up for that with a deep rich malt character, roasted malts, and cherry in the background.  I had this put up next to the original cherry and the cherry in this one was a bit more hidden due to the high alcohol content and the flavors associated with it.  Good brew, but could use some aroma work.
Pours black, little head. Vanilla, oak, whisky and cherry nose. Flavor is about the same, sweet. Very good.

Bottle shared with me by puddintane.  This was really terrible I felt.  All bourbon and wood flavors with not a hint of cherry.  A really boozy mess in my opinion.  Perhaps an aged sample is in order...

12oz bottle thanks to northernbrews. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is bourbon, oak, vanilla and sour cherry. Flavor is one of a kind. Bourbon, oak, tart cherries, chocolate malt and vanilla. Very complex for a sweet stout. Not something I would want everyday but definitiely a brew I am glad to try. Would be interesting if they made Expedition a cherry stout and then put it in bourbon barrells.

Bottle from Bobby91w, thank you! Pours black with a medium tan head. Aroma is  huge oak, bourbon, cherry, vanilla. Flavor is incredible! Bourbon, sour cherry, dark roasted malt, lots of oak, chocolate, vanilla, very nice! This was a real treat and a very nice way to end a great day of beer sampling.

Finally putting in a rating for this after having it a few times.  I guess you could say this would cover all of my experiences with it.  A large tart nose thats quickly robbed by a burning bourbon.  Pours very black with minimal head.  When fresh, its almost a bourbon stout with a hint of cherry, and when aged, its a muddle of cherry and smokey bourbon.  I think i prefer it fresh so the flavors dont overlap and get in the way of each other.  The bourbon barrel used is a unique flavor and smell.  Palate is cream and thick.  I think i liked the regular cherry stout more, because of its simplicity and complex at the same time, but this really is a great beer on its own.

Bottle, thanks Mike.  Strong aroma of oak, bourbon, cherry, and smoke.  Tart cherries in the aroma, coffee, some chocolate.  Big and creamy, lots of well integrated cherry, oak and smoky bourbon.  Vanilla, pie crust.  Excellent.

Opaque black with a thin, fine light tan head.  Dry, creamy, aroma with lots of coconut, Bourbon elements, caramel, and toffee. Flavor is full of roasted malt aspects, cherry tartness, and soft caramel and Bourbon notes.  The body is lighter than I would have expected for a beer of this intense complexity--a bit thin to deliver all of the various aspects here. All-in-all a very solid beer thats got a lot of fun stuff going on.

Thanks zuluflyboy for the share.  Pours dark brown with a dark head.  Nose is bourbon, chocolate, roasted malt, booze, sour cherry, alcohol, and depth.  Flavor is bourbon, sour cherry, whiskey, chocolate, earth, and a slight vinegary twinge hanging around in there somewhere.  Nice yellow lacing upon the swirl and lingering chocolate-covered sour cherry in this full-bodied beer.  Thoroughly enjoyable.
Thanks to Nothernbrews and GoldTwins for these.  Aroma of Duncan Hines vanilla cake icing.  Flavor strong bourbon, slight cherry tartness.  Very good.

Pours a coca-cola black with a red hue. Minimal head and slight lacing. Aroma is nice and sweet, a great mix of cherries, vanilla, dough, and chocolate. Flavor is very nice, lots of wood, vanilla, and cherries, with touches of chocolate, bourbon, and yeast. Nice hint of smoke in both the aroma and the flavor. Everything was held in a nice balance. Not overly complex, but a nice beer nonetheless.

Bottle. Pours a deep dark brown with a tan ring. Rich aroma, of cherry syrup, malt, and wood. Big cherry syrup taste, with malt, bourbon, and dark fruits. Lingering sweet sharpness. Tasty, but I think I prefer the non BA version.

Bottle:  Deep, dark brown pour with a small brown head.  Aroma is bourbon filled with a little sweet cherry juice.  Flavor is what brings this down for me.  Overtly bourbon filled with a bland, artificial cherry presence.  Light malt, but that is it.  Not nearly what Id hoped for; a big letdown.

Bottle, batch 7777. Aroma quite buttery and woody with sweet notes from the bourbon, almost candied sugar-like. Flavor contrasts the sweet bourbon notes with the tart cherry notes, with the butter/wood taking more of a back seat. I thought the tartness of the cherry was far too prominent in the regular cherry stout, and the bourbon and wood were nice compliments. However, by the end of the glass, the tartness was really starting build, not quite to the point of sour milk as I found in the regular, but still overriding the balancing components. Certainly an improvement for me though.

Bottle, batch 7777.  Pours black with a small tan head.  Aroma is heavy on the diacetyl and bourbon.  Flavor is sweet and bourbony with diacetyl in the background and butterscotch in the finish.  The cherry is much less pronounced than in the regular cherry stout--here its just more of a sweetness.  Sticky and a bit heavier than the regular too.  I cant really say its an improvement....not really a fan.
6/4/6/3/13 (3.2/5)

Bottle thanks to SoLan. Poured black with nice tan head. Aroma was cherry bourbon and lots of alcohol. Taste is wood, cherry, burnt malt, bourbon, and alcohol. Nice texture and mouth feel. Overall enjoyed...

Bottle shared by wolf at SL. Good head, black in color. Aroma is alcohol... Taste like a sweet cherry tea and alcohol. Not that well balanced. The bourbon note definetly doesnt go well with the cherry. The texture was a little thin for a stout but not watery. Overall, just an ok beer.

B8K.  Near black.  Thick, woody nose with light cherry....almost mead-like.  Cherry, chocolate, some barrel notes on the palate.  Big body.  Candyish, though, the way the cherry comes across.  Its a little bit crazy, unfocused.  Really doesnt come together - the elements seem to contrast rather than complement.

12-oz. Pours jet black. Creamy burnt tan head. Big sweet cherry and chocolate nose. Creamy, sticky body on the high side of medium. Chocolate and sweet tree fruit on the mid-palate. Long sticky sweet finish.

Dark beer out of the bottle with a foamy brown head.  Big bourbon barrel nose with cherry liqueur notes.  This is a great example of a beer being enhanced by time in a bourbon barrel, instead of getting overpowered by it.  Lots of dark cherry fruitiness with vanilla, oak, butter and of course the bourbon in the background warming it all up.  Smooth alcohol finish.  Really nice beer.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2009 Hand-pump by Larry Bell in Jupiter. Pours black with little to no head. Cherry liquor aromas do not scream bourbon and neither to the flavors, which are featuring solid black cherry goodness more than wood or bourbon. Liked it a lot. Compared with the regular cherry stout, the BB version has extra vanilla and the barrel beautifully changes the character and dries the beer out very well, adding tannins without taking the cherry tartness away.

Bottle from Hoppymeal awhile back - thanks!  This one has a nice blackish brown color with a big aroma of bourbon, roast, cherries, wood, and vanilla.  Flavorl has a nice choco/roasty/cherry mix with some mild oak/vanilla.  Nicely balanced with a pleasant finish.  I wouldnt mind a few more of these!

Tasting @ argo0s place. 12 oz bottle courtesy of kmweaver. This beer was the star of the show for me! Pours an oily black with a thick brown head. Big, sweet chocolate cherry nose, some vanilla notes, light Bourbon. Sweet flavors, rich chocolate and cherry, Bourbon complements - not overBourbonated! Silky smooth, rich body. Absolutely luscious...
